title: Power Virtual Server DR Automation
introduction: Power Virtual Server DR Automation is a cloud solution to enable Disaster Recovery capability for your power virtual servers.

Architecture for Power Virtual Server DR Automation in Client Location (Private Cloud)

section_highlights.title: Planning and Building Disaster Recovery Solutions
section_highlights.description: This course introduces the concepts of disaster recovery and high availability and how they relate to IBM Cloud.

tiles.title: You can now deploy the orchestrator with minimal inputs. You no longer need to provide schematic or custom VPC details. The orchestrator uses a private endpoint to communicate with all required IBM Cloud services.
You can now enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for the DR automation orchestrator to enhance login security.

You can now assign roles to users and manage permissions through the new User Role Management feature, which introduces role-based access control (RBAC) for creating users, defining roles, and controlling access to DR automation operations.
You can now generate consolidated operational reports for the external orchestrator, including Discovery, Move, Failover Rehearsal, and Cleanup activities.
You can now manage custom SSL certificates and private-key pairs for GUI communication.
